problem_text:
15.98. Let F be a saturated formation, and G a finite soluble minimal non-F-group such that GF is a Sylow p-subgroup of G. Is it true that GF is isomorphic to a factor group of the Sylow p-subgroup of PSU(3, p2n)? This is true for the formation of finite nilpotent groups (V. D. Mazurov, S. A. Syskin, Math. Notes, 14, no. 2 (1973), 683–686; A. Kh. Zhurtov, S. A. Syskin, Siberian Math. J., 26, no. 2 (1987), 235–239).
L. A. Shemetkov
